intro: Cheiranthus hirtus, commonly known as the hairy wallflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in alpine or coastal areas. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, with four petals and prominent yellow stamens. The hairy hirtus is known for its resilience and ability to thrive in harsh environmental conditions.
